sentence.Network_en: To him all this strongly smelled of the Battle of Balaclava.
sentence.Network_cn: 在他看来,这一切真使人不由想起巴拉克拉瓦战役.

sentence.Network_en: Iris Thompson lives in Balaclava , high in the central mountains of western Jamaica.
sentence.Network_cn: 艾里斯·汤普森生活在马拉克拉法, 西牙买加的中部高山上.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 巴拉克拉法帽　　巴拉克拉法帽（Balaclava）　　一种几乎完全围住头和脖子的羊毛兜帽，仅露双眼，有的也露鼻子。　　巴拉克拉法帽发 …
巴拉克拉瓦(Balaclava)战役——英军历史上最拙劣的战争美洲原住民的最后抵抗——完美的胜利和稚拙的复仇史上最昂贵的耳光—— …
头套(balaclava)起到面部不被落冰刺伤的作用。
毛里求斯的巴拉克瓦(Balaclava)是深受当地游客和外国旅客喜爱的知名旅游胜地. HotelClub提供巴拉克瓦(Balaclava)3间便宜的住宿选择.

list.abs: skiing balaclava covered the robber's face .滑雪帽遮住了他的脸。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent. (worn originally by soldiers on active service in the Crimean War): named after the village of Balaclava in the Crimea (see Balaclava, Battle of)

entry.def: A balaclava is a tight woollen hood that covers every part of your head except your face.

means.word_mean: 1. a cap that is close-fitting and woolen and covers all of the head but the face
